◆ CannyEdgeDetection()

void CannyEdgeDetection ( cv::Mat &  imageToProc,
cv::Mat &  resultCanny,
int  GaussianBlurKernelSize = 9,
double  CannyUpperThresholdCoeff = 1,
double  CannyLowerThresholdCoeff = 0.5,
int  CannyMorphIters = 1 
)

Edge detection using Canny edge detector.

Parameters
[in]imageToProcInput image.
[out]resultCannyOutput image.
[in]GaussianBlurKernelSizeKernel size for Gaussian blur (if less or equal than 0 then procedure is not used).
[in]CannyUpperThresholdCoeffCoefficient for upper threshold of Canny edge detector.
[in]CannyLowerThresholdCoeffCoefficient for lower threshold of Canny edge detector.
[in]CannyMorphItersParameter of erode and dilatation (if equal than 0 then procedures are not used. If above than 0 then dilate is used the first. If less than 0 then erode is used the first).

This function separates image into channels, processes them and combine by logical OR.

Split channels

  1. make Gaussian blur if it required
  2. get Otsu threshold...

... and calculate thresholds for ...

... 3. Canny edge detection

  1. approve morphology operations if them required
  2. combine result by logical OR

◆ cropVerticesOrdering()

bool cropVerticesOrdering ( std::vector< cv::Point > &  pt)

Contour points ordering.

Parameters
[in,out]ptContour.
Returns
true if ordering is successful.

This should be 4 for rectangles, but it allows to be extended to more complex cases

Find convex hull of points

Find top left point, as starting point. This is the nearest to (0.0) point

Now starting point index in source array is in indices[minDistanceIdx] convex hull vertices are sorted clockwise in indices array, so transfer them to result beginning from starting point to the end of array...

... and from the begin of array up to starting point

Definition at line 468 of file imageLibCommon.cpp.

◆ IsContourCorrect()

bool IsContourCorrect ( std::vector< cv::Point > &  contour,
cv::Mat &  image,
size_t  contourMinSize = 8,
float  contourAreaCoeff = 0.7f,
float  aspectRatioRangeMin = 0.1f,
float  aspectRatioRangeMax = 10.0f 
)

Checks contour for compliance.

Parameters
[in]contourTested contour.
[in]imageImage which contains contour.
[in]contourMinSizeMinimal contour size.
[in]contourAreaCoeffCoefficient of maximal contour area.
[in]aspectRatioRangeMinAspect ratio range minimal value.
[in]aspectRatioRangeMaxAspect ratio range maximal value.
Returns
true if contour meets requirements

This function checks contour for compliance:

  • The aspect ratio is constrained to lie between aspectRatioRangeMin and aspectRatioRangeMax to remove highly elongated components.
  • Components larger than contourAreaCoeff times the image dimensions are removed.
  • Furthermore, small and spurious components with areas less than contourMinSize pixels are not considered for further processing.

get bounding rectangle

Definition at line 525 of file imageLibCommon.cpp.

◆ IsContourUncorrect()

bool IsContourUncorrect ( std::vector< cv::Point > &  contour,
cv::Mat &  image,
size_t  contourMinSize = 8,
float  contourAreaCoeff = 0.7f,
float  aspectRatioRangeMin = 0.1f,
float  aspectRatioRangeMax = 10.0f 
)

Checks contour for compliance.

Parameters
[in]contourTested contour.
[in]imageImage which contains contour.
[in]contourMinSizeMinimal contour size.
[in]contourAreaCoeffCoefficient of maximal contour area.
[in]aspectRatioRangeMinAspect ratio range minimal value.
[in]aspectRatioRangeMaxAspect ratio range maximal value.
Returns
false if contour meets requirements

This function checks contour for compliance:

  • The aspect ratio is constrained to lie between aspectRatioRangeMin and aspectRatioRangeMax to remove highly elongated components.
  • Components larger than contourAreaCoeff times the image dimensions are removed.
  • Furthermore, small and spurious components with areas less than contourMinSize pixels are not considered for further processing.

Definition at line 821 of file imageLibCommon.cpp.

◆ MatToLocalVarianceMap()

void MatToLocalVarianceMap ( const cv::Mat &  image,
cv::Mat &  varianceMap,
const int  kernelSize = 3 
)

Get local variance map for OpenCV Mat.

Parameters
[in]imageInput image.
[out]varianceMapResulting local variance map.
[in]kernelSizeSize of area for variance value estimation.

This function estimate local variance value in area selected by sliding window with size (kernelSize x kernelSize). Estimated values are stored to corresponding position of variance_map.

we work with float data

images used for variance_map calculation

filter kernel parameters for (kernel_size x kernel_size) area

minimal allowable variance value

create filter kernel for variance calculation

sum(x[i])

sum(x[i])^2

x[i]^2

sum(x[i]^2)

calculate local variance map

If local variance value in point (x, y) above than variance_min_value (it is constant which empirically defined as 0.01) then variance in this point is assigned to variance_min_value.
